Example 5 illustrates a first of two methods for removal of TBC from 1,3-butadiene feed.

1,3-butadiene is charged to a flash drum at near-atmospheric pressure. Heat input to the flash drum is approximately 417.8 kJ/kg of 1,3-butadiene feed. TBC is drawn off as a bottoms product. The 1,3-butadiene is then cooled and condensed before flowing the purified 1,3-butadiene to the first reaction zone (Z1).

heading.b: Example 6 - Caustic Wash to Remove TBC

description.p: 1,3-butadiene is flashed and charged to a lower inlet of a countercurrent gas-liquid contactor while an aqueous NaOH solution is charged to the top of the contactor through a liquid distributor. The purified, wet 1,3-butadiene overhead stream is then charged to a mutli-bed molecular sieve dryer piped and valved in parallel to allow selective sorption and regeneration. Dry nitrogen or dry flare gas is back-charged through the molecular sieve beds for regeneration. The dried, caustic-washed 1,3-butadiene contains less than about 5 ppm TBC.

heading.b: Example 7 - Direct Sorption to Remove TBC

description.p: Liquid 1,3-butadiene is charged to a first of two sorption beds containing an activated carbon sorbent as taught in U.S. Patent 4,547,619 to Diaz. As described for the molecular sieve dryer of Example 6, the activated carbon sorption beds are piped and valved in parallel to allow selective sorption and regeneration. As needed, the sorbent beds are selectively regenerated by heating or by passing a heated non-oxidizing gas, such as nitrogen or superheated steam, through the sorption bed. The flow of commercially delivered 1,3-butadiene through the sorbent bed is controlled to provide a purified 1,3-butadiene intermediate product stream containing less than about 5 ppm TBC.

heading.b: Example 8 - Production of Vinylcyclohexane (VCH) - Normal Unit Operation

description.p: Examples 2 and 3 are repeated and VCH formation is monitored. VCH is an undesired byproduct of the first reaction zone (Z1). VCH is a cyclic dimerization product formed by 1,3-butadiene and thus represents a yield loss of adiponitrile. During normal continuous operation, the VCH content of the crude reaction product of the first reaction zone (Z1) of Example 2 is measured and compared with the VCH content of the crude reaction product of the first reaction zone (Z1) of Example 3. VCH formation in the Example 2 crude pentenenitrile product stream is about 1% higher than that of Example 3.

heading.b: Example 9 - Production of Vinylcyclohexane (VCH) - Startup and Shutdown Unit Operation

description.p: Example 8 is repeated during unit startup and unit shutdown. During unit startup and shutdown, 1,3-butadiene recycle is increased, due in part to lower per-pass conversions and also by design to stabilize unit operations. VCH production increases as a function of contact time between the catalyst of the first reaction zone and the 1,3-butadiene, with VCH formation in the Example 3 (monodentate ligand in Z1 and Z2, bidentate ligand in Z3) process configuration consistently being lower than that of the Example 2 configuration (bidentate ligand in all of Z1, Z2 and Z3 reaction zones).

heading.b: Comparative Example 10 - Removal of C9 mononitriles

description.p: This Example 10 illustrates the building up of C9 mononitriles in an integrated catalyst recovery/regeneration loop. Example 1 is repeated and the concentration of C9 mononitriles is measured at the outlet of the first reaction zone (Z1). Concentrations vary during the run, ranging from about 1000 ppm to about 10,000 ppm based on total reaction zone effluent. Using the integrated catalyst purification system of Example 1, the C9 mononitriles accumulate in the catalyst loop. As the concentration of C9 mononitriles builds in the catalyst loop, these C9 mononitriles are at least partially transferred into the 3-pentenenitrile-enriched feed to the third reaction zone (Z3), where they readily convert to DDNs and degrade the quality of the crude as-produced dinitrile product.

heading.b: Example 11 - Removal of C9 Mononitriles with Segregated Catalyst Recovery Systems

description.p: Example 3 is repeated.

Stream 126 has a higher concentration of (is enriched in) C9 mononitriles relative to the effluent from the first reaction zone (Z1). These C9 mononitriles proportion between the raffinate and extract phases in the liquid/liquid extraction system. The raffinate is charged through line 510 and 515 to the first column K1 of separation section 1000. The C9 mononitriles concentrate in the K1 bottoms stream 520 where they are charged to column K2. Column K2 is operated such a majority of the C9 mononitriles leave the column in the bottoms stream 530, where they flow to column K3 and exit via 535, then via 420 from column K4.

heading.b: Example 12 - Removal of C9 mononitriles with MGN

description.p: Example 3 is repeated.

This Example 12 illustrates that the removal of MGN, C9 mononitriles, phenol and cresols from the reaction system, ultimately through the distillation train used to treat the raffinate stream from the extractor, may be facilitated by distilling the reaction product stream from the first reaction zone (Z1) in a particular manner. For example, after removing unreacted 1,3-butadiene and hydrogen cyanide from the reaction product stream 122 via distillation apparatus 810 as shown in Fig. 4, distillation apparatus 820 receives the bottoms stream (substantially free of 1,3-butadiene in this Example 12) from distillation apparatus 810 and is controlled to concentrate C9 mononitriles in the bottoms stream 140. Distillation apparatus 820 is controlled by selecting the number of stages in the rectification section and the reflux ratio to concentrate C9 mononitriles in the bottoms stream 140. The distillation apparatus 820 is operated in a manner such that the catalyst-enriched stream comprises at least 5% by weight of pentenenitrile including the sum of 3-pentenenitrile and 2-methyl-3-butenenitrile. In this way, MGN, C9 mononitriles, phenol and cresols tend to pass into the catalyst-enriched stream.
These compounds may then be removed from bottoms stream 140, and accordingly, at least in part from the reaction system, by a liquid/liquid extraction process, as described above.

The process conditions in distillation apparatus 820 can be adjusted to increase the relative concentration of pentenenitriles in the bottoms stream 140, thus decreasing the relative concentration of C9 mononitriles in the overhead stream 824. This tends to improve removal of C9 mononitriles from the system.

About 90% by weight of the C9 mononitriles present in the raffinate from the catalyst recovery system associated with the first reaction zone (Z1) are removed in the overhead stream of column K4. Conditions in distillation apparatus 820 are adjusted to provide C9 mononitrile concentration in the charge to the third reaction zone (Z3) of less than 1500 ppm, for example less than 1000, less than 500 ppm, or less than 100 ppm depending upon the purity requirements for the as-produced dinitrile effluent from the third reaction zone (Z3).

heading.b: Example 13 - Enhanced Removal of C9 mononitriles - Chimney Tray Side Draw Column

description.p: Example 12 is repeated.

This Example 13 illustrates enhanced removal of C9 mononitriles using a particular tray and pumparound configuration for the bottom tray of distillation apparatus 820 of Fig. 4, included in separation section 125 in Fig. 1.

One of the problems attendant to recycling catalyst to the first reaction zone (Z1) is that dinitriles formed in the first reaction zone (Z1) tend to build up in the catalyst recycle loop. This problem is at least partially mitigated by installing a chimney tray in the pentenenitrile separation column, referred to here as distillation apparatus 820.
For this Example 13, distillation apparatus 820 in Fig. 4 is fitted with a chimney tray.
This distillation apparatus 820 in Fig. 4 is illustrated with a chimney tray as distillation apparatus 850 in Fig. 6.

The chimney tray 870 is located at a point just above the feed inlet 852. Liquid accumulates on the chimney tray and is drawn off via line 872 and pump 874, charged via line 876 to trim heater 880 with capacity sufficient to vaporize at least part of the feed to the trim heater. The heated stream 882 is then returned to the chimney tray 870 or at a point along the distillation apparatus 850 just above the chimney tray 870,

A catalyst-enriched liquid accumulates in the bottom section of distillation apparatus 850, and is heated by a reboiler 866. Above the chimney tray 870, the pentenenitrile separation column may contain one or more stages of separation in the form of trays or packing 854. The overhead stream 856 may be partially condensed and the liquid refluxed to the top of the distillation apparatus 850.

The side draw stream 878 downstream from pump 874 is enriched in C9 mononitriles and dinitriles. This process configuration of Example 13 reduces the C9 mononitrile and dinitrile content of the recycled catalyst stream to the first reaction zone (Z1) and provides a stream concentrated in C9 mononitriles and dinitriles for more effectively removing these components from the process upstream of the third reaction zone (Z3). By operating this chimney tray side draw configuration of Example 13, flow of C9 mononitriles and dinitriles to the third reaction zone (Z3) is reduced.

heading.b: Example 14 - Comparison of C9 mononitrile formation in Examples 2 and 3

description.p: Examples 2 and 3 are repeated, and the total production of C9 mononitriles from the first reaction zone (Z1) is measured.

In Example 3, the catalyst comprising the monodentate ligand produces a mixed pentenenitrile product from the first reaction zone (Z1) containing about 500 ppm of C9 mononitriles. In Example 2, the catalyst comprising the bidentate ligand produces a mixed pentenenitrile product from the first reaction zone (Z1) containing from about 1000 to 10000 or more ppm of C9 mononitriles.
This Example 15 illustrates another option to reduce the concentration of C9 mononitriles in the feed to the third reaction zone (Z3).

One method to reduce the content of C9 mononitriles in the 3-pentenenitrile feed to the third reaction zone (Z3) is to modify the operation of Example 2 by distilling the 3-pentenenitrile feedstream to provide an overhead stream enriched in 3-pentenenitrile and a bottoms stream enriched in C9 mononitriles.

The 3-pentenenitrile product from the first reaction zone (Z1), and optionally isomerized pentenenitrile effluent ("isomerate") from the second reaction zone (Z2), is charged to a multistage distillation column equipped with an overhead condenser and return piping with one or more control valves for adjusting column pressure and reflux ratio. The multistage distillation column also includes one or more reboilers and optional interstage heaters below the feed point for vaporizing liquid in the column. The column operation is controlled to provide an overhead stream enriched in 3-pentenenitrile and a bottom stream enriched in C9 mononitriles and dinitriles including MGN. Energy input to this column for flashing, cooling and condensing essentially all of the 3-pentenenitrile effluent from the second reaction zone (Z2) significantly increases the total energy consumption per unit time of the ADN process in comparison to Examples 2 and 3 operated without this additional distillation step.

heading.b: Example 16 - Enhanced Removal of Intermediate Boilers

description.p: In this Example 16, Example 13 is repeated.

Example 16 illustrates enhanced removal of intermediate boilers, such as MGN, C8H13C≡N compounds, phenol and cresols from the reaction system, ultimately through the distillation and liquid/liquid separation sections by selectively treating stream 878 withdrawn from distillation apparatus 850 as shown in Fig. 6.

These compounds may then be removed at least in part from the reaction system by the extraction process into the raffinate and from the raffinate by the raffinate treatment process described above. The stream from the side draw 878 may then be passed either directly or indirectly (e.g., into the catalyst purge stream) to the extraction section. In this way, there is achieved an increased amount of MGN, C8H13C≡N compounds, phenol and cresols passed into the extraction section and separated from recycled catalyst. Optionally, stream 878 can be fed to a multistage extraction section after the first stage of the multistage extraction section to further improve C9 mononitrile rejection.
This Example 17 illustrates the behavior of tertiary-butylcatechol (TBC) in the disclosed process.

Tertiary-butylcatechol (TBC) is a polymerization inhibitor, which inhibits the polymerization of 1,3-butadiene, particularly while the 1,3-butadiene is in storage. Commercial sources of 1,3-butadiene often include small amounts of TBC to inhibit polymerization of 1,3-butadiene.
TBC reacts with monodentate phosphite ligands and bidentate phosphite ligands.

TBC in the 1,3-butadiene feed triggers a number of problems. TBC reacts with ligand in the first reaction zone (Z1) to form TBC byproducts which complex with nickel and TBC byproducts which react with catalyst ligands. These nickel-containing complexes appear to be less catalytically active than the nickel-ligand complex of the first catalyst. Reactive TBC byproducts of the TBC reaction in the first reaction zone (Z1) further include compounds, such as phenol and cresols, which may further react with catalyst ligand in the third reaction zone (Z3). The reaction of these reactive TBC byproducts with catalyst ligand in the third reaction zone (Z3) causes similar problems in that new nickel-containing complexes are generated. These newly generated nickel-containing complexes are less catalytically active than the nickel-ligand complex of the third catalyst. As described below, a portion of the reactive TBC byproducts is rejected into the raffinate phase of a liquid/liquid extraction section and removed from the process.

Examples 2 and 3 are repeated. The reactive TBC byproducts (e.g., phenol and cresols) described above are withdrawn from the K4 column of Fig. 2 as overheads. This withdrawal through the K4 column is made possible by operating the pentenenitrile separation column (K2) to keep most of the TBC byproducts out of the pentenenitrile separation column overheads.
Example 2 is repeated. The catalyst in the first, second and third reactions zones (Z1, Z2 and Z3) contains a bidentate phosphite ligand.

A portion of the bidentate ligand in the first reaction zone (Z1) catalyst loop reacts with water to form light ligand hydrolysis product (LLHP) and heavy ligand hydrolysis product (HLHP). The purge from the catalyst loop is contacted in the extraction system. The raffinate (polar) phase from the extraction system is charged to separation section 1000. The LLHP is removed from the system via the overheads 420 of K4 and the HLHP is removed from the system via line 540 from K3.

heading.b: Example 19 - Removal of Ligand Hydrolysis Products

description.p: Example 3 is repeated. The catalyst in the first and second reaction zones (Z1 and Z2) contains a monodentate phosphite ligand and the catalyst in the third reaction zone (Z3) contains a bidentate phosphite ligand.

A portion of the bidentate ligand in the first reaction zone (Z1) catalyst loop reacts with water to form light ligand hydrolysis product (LLHP) and heavy ligand hydrolysis product (HLHP). The purge from the catalyst loop is contacted in the extraction system.

The raffinate (polar) phase from the extraction system is charged to separation section 1000. The LLHP is removed from the system via the overheads 420 of K4 and the HLHP is removed from the system via line 540 from K3.

heading.b: Example 20 - Removal of MGN through liquid-liquid extraction

description.p: Example 3 is repeated. The crude product of the first reaction zone principally contains pentenenitriles and unreacted 1,3-butadiene, but also contains a minor portion of dinitriles including adiponitrile (ADN) and methylglutaronitrile (MGN).

The catalyst flowing from the first reaction zone (Z1) or the second reaction zone (Z2) or both the first and second reaction zone is concentrated in one or more distillation columns and recycled in at least one catalyst recycle stream to the first reaction zone (Z1) or the second reaction zone (Z2) or both the first and second reaction zone (Z1 and Z2).

At least a portion of the catalyst recycle stream is contacted with an extraction solvent in a liquid/liquid extraction step to produce a solvent phase and a raffinate phase. The solvent phase comprises extraction solvent and catalyst and the raffinate phase comprises the dinitrile compounds comprising MGN, compounds with a higher boiling point than the dinitrile compounds and compounds with a lower boiling point than the dinitrile compounds. The catalyst from the solvent phase obtained in the liquid/liquid extraction step is then recycled to the first reaction zone or the second reaction zone or both the first and second reaction zone.

heading.b: Example 21 - Isolating the First and Second Reaction Zones from the Lewis acid of the Third Reaction Zone

description.p: Example 3 is repeated except that ZnCl2 (Lewis acid) from the third reaction zone Z3 is charged back to the first reaction zone (Z1). The crude product from the first reaction zone (Z1) is continuously monitored for dinitrile content. Several minutes after the control valve is partially opened to charge the Lewis acid from the third reaction zone back to the first reaction zone at a concentration of about 100 ppm of zinc, based on total catalyst charged to the first reaction zone, the control valve is opened further to increase the zinc charge to the first reaction zone to about 500 ppm. At 100 ppm zinc, the crude product contains about 0.5% by weight MGN. Increasing the Lewis acid charge to 500 ppm increases the production of MGN to about 1.0% by weight of crude product from the first reaction zone (Z1).

heading.b: Comparative Example 22 - Zinc Chloride in the Extraction Solvent

description.p: Example 1 is repeated. The cyclohexane extraction from the shared catalyst extraction system is analyzed for Zn as taught in U.S. Patent 3,778,809 to Walter.

About 100 ppm of Zn in the recycled catalyst correlates with about 0.8% MGN yield. Increasing the Zn level in the recycled catalyst by another 100 ppm increases the MGN yield by another 0.5% for a total of 1.3% (weight).

Adiponitrile is produced by the two-step hydrocyanation of 1,3-butadiene by reacting in a first reaction zone a mixture comprising 1,3-butadiene (BD) and hydrogen cyanide (HCN) in the presence of a first catalyst comprising zero-valent Ni and a first phosphorus-containing ligand to produce a reaction product comprising 3-pentenenitrile (3PN) and 2-methyl-3-butenenitrile (2M3BN).

At least a portion of the 2M3BN from the first reaction zone is isomerized in a second reaction zone in the presence of a second catalyst comprising zero-valent Ni and a second phosphorus-containing ligand to produce reaction product comprising 3PN.

A mixture comprising 3PN from the second reaction zone and hydrogen cyanide (HCN) is reacted in the presence of a third catalyst comprising zero-valent Ni and a third phosphorus-containing ligand and in the presence of Lewis acid promoter to produce a reaction product comprising adiponitrile.
The catalyst flows through the first, second and third reaction zones along with reactants and products.
The first catalyst is recycled to the first reaction zone through a first catalyst recycle loop.
The third catalyst is recycled to the third reaction zone through a separate catalyst recycle loop.
The catalyst recycle loops for recycling the first and third catalysts are different.
A portion of the first catalyst concentrated in the first recycle loop of the first stage is purified by a liquid/liquid extraction step.
Purified first catalyst is returned to the first reaction zone.

The process of Example 23 is repeated with additional steps. In this Example 24, the separate catalyst recycle loops for recycling the first and third catalysts comprise one or more distillation apparatus for concentrating catalyst, and the distillation apparatus of the separate catalyst recycle loops are different.

The process of Example 24 is repeated with additional steps. A portion of the concentrated first catalyst in the first catalyst recycle loop is purged by taking a purge stream from the first catalyst recycle loop. The first catalyst in the purge stream is purified and at least a portion of the purified first catalyst is returned to the first reaction zone.

The process of Example 25 is repeated with additional steps. The purge stream from the first catalyst recycle loop is passed into a first liquid/liquid extraction zone along with a dinitrile stream and a solvent extraction stream. The liquids in the extraction zone are separated into an extraction solvent phase comprising the first catalyst and raffinate phase comprising dinitriles.

The process of Example 26 is repeated with additional steps. The extraction solvent phase from the first liquid/liquid extraction zone is distilled to provide the purified catalyst which is returned to the first reaction zone.

The process of Example 27 is repeated with additional steps. The raffinate phase comprises extraction solvent, pentenenitriles, dintiriles and catalyst degradation products. The extraction solvent, pentenenitriles, dintiriles and catalyst degradation products are separated from one another, and dinitriles are recycled to the first liquid/liquid extraction zone.

The process of Example 28 is repeated with additional steps. At least a portion of the raffinate phase is passed to an adiponitrile product recovery section for recovering adiponitrile produced in a third reaction zone (Z3).

The process of Example 29 is repeated. At least a portion of the raffinate phase is passed to a dinitrile recyle loop, which is different from the adiponitrile product recovery section for recovering adiponitrile produced in the third reaction zone (Z3).

The process of Example 30 is repeated with additional steps. Effluent from third reaction zone (Z3) is fed to a separate liquid/liquid extraction zone which is different from the first liquid/liquid extraction zone. An extraction solvent is also fed to the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone. The liquids in the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone are separated into an extraction solvent phase comprising the third catalyst and a raffinate phase comprising dinitriles.

The process of Example 31 is repeated with additional steps. The extraction solvent phase from the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone is distilled to provide purified third catalyst which is recycled to the third reaction zone (Z3).

The process of Example 32 is repeated with additional steps. The raffinate phase from the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone is passed from the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone into an adiponitrile product recovery section, wherein extraction solvent, pentenenitriles, dintiriles and catalyst degradation products are separated from one another. The adiponitrile is further separated from other dinitriles, and is recovered.
The process Example 33 is repeated with additional steps. A portion of the adiponitrile recovered in the adiponitrile product recovery section is recycled to the first liquid/liquid extraction zone.

The process of Example 34 is repeated with additional features. The first phosphorus-containing ligand is a monodentate phosphorus-containing ligand. The second phosphorus-containing ligand is a monodentate phosphorus-containing ligand or a bidentate phosphorus-containing ligand. The third phosphorus-containing ligand is a bidentate phosphorus-containing ligand.

The process of Example 35 is repeated with additional features. The second phosphorus-containing ligand is a monodentate phosphorus-containing ligand. The first phosphorus-containing ligand and the second phosphorus-containing ligand are the same.

It should be noted that ratios, concentrations, amounts, and other numerical data may be expressed herein in a range format. It is to be understood that such a range format is used for convenience and brevity, and thus, should be interpreted in a flexible manner to include not only the numerical values explicitly recited as the limits of the range, but also to include all the individual numerical values or sub-ranges encompassed within that range as if each numerical value and sub-range is explicitly recited. To illustrate, a concentration range of "about 0.1% to about 5%" should be interpreted to include not only the explicitly recited concentration of about 0.1 wt% to about 5 wt%, but also the individual concentrations (e.g., 1%, 2%, 3%, and 4%) and the sub-ranges (e.g., 0.5%, 1.1%, 2.2%, 3.3%, and 4.4%) within the indicated range. The term "about" can include ±1%, ±2%, ±3%, ±4%, ±5%, ±8%, or ±10%, of the numerical value(s) being modified. In addition, the phrase "about 'x' to 'y'" includes "about 'x' to about 'y'".

claim.claim-text:
Verfahren zur Herstellung von Adiponitril, umfassend die Stufen: (a) Umsetzen einer Mischung, die 1,3-Butadien (BD) und Cyanwasserstoff (HCN) umfasst, in einer ersten Reaktionszone in Gegenwart eines ersten Katalysators, der nullwertiges Ni und einen ersten phosphorhaltigen Liganden umfasst, um ein Reaktionsprodukt zu produzieren, das 3-Pentennitril (3PN) und 2-Methyl-3-butennitril (2M3BN) umfasst; (b) Isomerisieren von mindestens einem Teil des 2M3BN aus Stufe (a) in einer zweiten Reaktionszone in Gegenwart eines zweiten Katalysators, der nullwertiges Ni und einen zweiten phosphorhaltigen Liganden umfasst, um Reaktionsprodukt zu produzieren, das 3PN umfasst; und (c) Umsetzen einer Mischung, die 3PN umfasst, aus Stufe (b) und Cyanwasserstoff (HCN) in einer dritten Reaktionszone in Gegenwart eines dritten Katalysators, der nullwertiges Ni und einen dritten phosphorhaltigen Liganden umfasst, und in Gegenwart von Lewis-Säurepromotor, um ein Reaktionsprodukt zu produzieren, das Adiponitril umfasst; wobei Katalysator zusammen mit Reaktanten und Produkten durch die erste, zweite und dritte Reaktionszone fließt,
wobei der erste Katalysator durch eine erste Katalysator-Recyclingschleife in die erste Reaktionszone recycelt wird,
wobei der dritte Katalysator durch eine separate Katalysator-Recyclingschleife in die dritte Reaktionszone recycelt wird,
wobei die Katalysator-Recyclingschleifen zum Recyceln des ersten und dritten Katalysators verschieden sind,
wobei ein Teil des ersten Katalysators, der in der ersten Recyclingschleife der ersten Stufe konzentriert wird, durch eine Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionsstufe gereinigt wird, und
wobei gereinigter erster Katalysator in die erste Reaktionszone zurückgegeben wird.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 1, wobei die separaten Katalysator-Recyclingschleifen zum Recyceln des ersten und dritten Katalysators eine oder mehrere Destillationsapparaturen zum Konzentrieren von Katalysator umfassen, und wobei die Destillationsapparaturen der separaten Katalysator-Recyclingschleifen unterschiedlich sind.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 1, wobei ein Teil des konzentrierten ersten Katalysators in der ersten Katalysator-Recyclingschleife gespült wird, indem ein Spülstrom aus der ersten Katalysator-Recyclingschleife genommen wird, wobei der erste Katalysator in dem Spülstrom gereinigt wird, und
wobei mindestens ein Teil des gereinigten ersten Katalysators in die erste Reaktionszone zurückgegeben wird.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 3, wobei der Spülstrom aus der ersten Katalysator-Recyclingschleife zusammen mit einem Dinitrilstrom und einem Lösungsmittelextraktionsstrom in eine erste Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone geleitet wird,
wobei die Flüssigkeiten in der Extraktionszone in eine Extraktionslösungsmittelphase, die den ersten Katalysator umfasst, und Raffinatphase, die Dinitrile umfasst, getrennt werden.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 4, wobei die Extraktionslösungsmittelphase aus der ersten Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone destilliert wird, um den gereinigten Katalysator zu liefern, der in die erste Reaktionszone zurückgegeben wird.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 4, wobei die Raffinatphase Extraktionslösungsmittel, Pentennitrile, Dinitrile und Katalysatorabbauprodukte umfasst,
wobei Extraktionslösungsmittel, Pentennitrile, Dinitrile und Katalyatorabbauprodukte voneinander getrennt werden und Dinitrile in die erste Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone recycelt werden.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 4, wobei mindestens ein Teil der Raffinatphase in einen Adiponitrilproduktgewinnungsabschnitt geleitet wird, um in der dritten Reaktionszone (Z3) produziertes Adiponitril zu gewinnen.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 4, wobei mindestens ein Teil der Raffinatphase in eine Dinitril-Recyclingschleife geleitet wird, die sich von dem Adiponitrilproduktgewinnungsabschnitt unterscheidet, um in der dritten Reaktionszone (Z3) produziertes Adiponitril zu gewinnen.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 8, wobei Ausfluss aus der dritten Reaktionszone (Z3) in eine separate Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone eingespeist wird, die sich von der ersten Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone unterscheidet,
wobei auch ein Extraktionslösungsmittel in die separate Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone eingespeist wird, und
wobei die Flüssigkeiten in der separaten Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone in eine Extraktionslösungsmittelphase, die den dritten Katalysator umfasst, und eine Raffinatphase, die Dinitrile umfasst, getrennt werden.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 9, wobei die Extraktionslösungsmittelphase aus der separaten Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone destilliert wird, um gereinigten dritten Katalysator zu liefern, der in die dritte Reaktionszone (Z3) zurückgegeben wird.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 10, wobei die Raffinatphase aus der separaten Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone von der separaten Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone in einen Adiponitrilproduktgewinnungsabschnitt geleitet wird, wobei Extraktionslösungsmittel, Pentennitrile, Dinitrile und Katalysatorabbauprodukte voneinander getrennt werden,
wobei Adiponitril ferner von anderen Dinitrilen getrennt wird, und
wobei Adiponitril gewonnen wird.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 11, wobei ein Teil des im Adiponitrilproduktgewinnungsabschnitt gewonnenen Adiponitrils in die erste Flüssig/Flüssig-Extraktionszone recycelt wird.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 1, wobei der erste phosphorhaltige Ligand ein einzähniger phosphorhaltiger Ligand ist,
wobei der zweite phosphorhaltige Ligand ein einzähniger phosphorhaltiger Ligand oder ein zweizähniger phosphorhaltiger Ligand ist, und
wobei der dritte phosphorhaltige Ligand ein zweizähniger phosphorhaltiger Ligand ist.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 13, wobei der zweite phosphorhaltige Ligand ein einzähniger phosphorhaltiger Ligand ist, und
wobei der erste phosphorhaltige Ligand und der zweite phosphorhaltige Ligand gleich sind.

A process for making adiponitrile, said process comprising the steps of: (a) reacting in a first reaction zone a mixture comprising 1,3-butadiene (BD) and hydrogen cyanide (HCN) in the presence of a first catalyst comprising zero-valent Ni and a first phosphorus-containing ligand to produce a reaction product comprising 3-pentenenitrile (3PN) and 2-methyl-3-butenenitrile (2M3BN); (b) isomerizing at least a portion of the 2M3BN of step (a) in a second reaction zone in the presence of a second catalyst comprising zero-valent Ni and a second phosphorus-containing ligand to produce reaction product comprising 3PN; and (c) reacting in a third reaction zone a mixture comprising 3PN from step (b) and hydrogen cyanide (HCN) in the presence of a third catalyst comprising zero-valent Ni and a third phosphorus-containing ligand and in the presence of Lewis acid promoter to produce a reaction product comprising adiponitrile, wherein catalyst flows through the first, second and third reaction zones along with reactants and products,
wherein the first catalyst is recycled to the first reaction zone through a first catalyst recycle loop,
wherein the third catalyst is recycled to the third reaction zone through a separate catalyst recycle loop,
wherein the catalyst recycle loops for recycling the first and third catalysts are different,
wherein a portion of the first catalyst concentrated in the first recycle loop of the first stage is purified by a liquid/liquid extraction step, and
wherein purified first catalyst is returned to the first reaction zone.

The process of claim 1, wherein the separate catalyst recycle loops for recycling the first and third catalysts comprise one or more distillation apparatus for concentrating catalyst, and wherein the distillation apparatus of the separate catalyst recycle loops are different.

The process of claim 1, wherein a portion of the concentrated first catalyst in the first catalyst recycle loop is purged by taking a purge stream from the first catalyst recycle loop,
wherein first catalyst in the purge stream is purified, and
wherein at least a portion of the purified first catalyst is returned to the first reaction zone.

The process of claim 3, wherein the purge stream from the first catalyst recycle loop is passed into a first liquid/liquid extraction zone along with a dinitrile stream and a solvent extraction stream,
wherein the liquids in the extraction zone are separated into an extraction solvent phase comprising the first catalyst and raffinate phase comprising dinitriles.
The process of claim 4, wherein the extraction solvent phase from the first liquid/liquid extraction zone is distilled to provide the purified catalyst which is returned to the first reaction zone.

The process of claim 4, wherein the raffinate phase comprises extraction solvent, pentenenitriles, dintiriles and catalyst degradation products,
wherein extraction solvent, pentenenitriles, dintiriles and catalyst degradation products are separated from one another, and dinitriles are recycled to the first liquid/liquid extraction zone.
The process of claim 4, wherein at least a portion of the raffinate phase is passed to an adiponitrile product recovery section for recovering adiponitrile produced in the third reaction zone (Z3).

The process of claim 4, wherein at least a portion of the raffinate phase is passed to a dinitrile recyle loop, which is different from the adiponitrile product recovery section for recovering adiponitrile produced in the third reaction zone (Z3).

The process of claim 8, wherein effluent from third reaction zone (Z3) is fed to a separate liquid/liquid extraction zone which is different from the first liquid/liquid extraction zone,
wherein an extraction solvent is also fed to the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone, and
wherein the liquids in the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone are separated into an extraction solvent phase comprising the third catalyst and a raffinate phase comprising dinitriles.

The process of claim 9, wherein the extraction solvent phase from the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone is distilled to provide purified third catalyst which is recycled to the third reaction zone (Z3).

The process of claim 10, wherein the raffinate phase from the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone is passed from the separate liquid/liquid extraction zone into an adiponitrile product recovery section, wherein extraction solvent, pentenenitriles, dintiriles and catalyst degradation products are separated from one another,
wherein adiponitrile is further separated from other dinitriles, and
wherein adiponitrile is recovered.
The process of claim 11, wherein a portion of the adiponitrile recovered in the adiponitrile product recovery section is recycled to the first liquid/liquid extraction zone.

The process of claim 1, wherein the first phosphorus-containing ligand is a monodentate phosphorus-containing ligand,
wherein the second phosphorus-containing ligand is a monodentate phosphorus-containing ligand or a bidentate phosphorus-containing ligand, and
wherein the third phosphorus-containing ligand is a bidentate phosphorus-containing ligand.

The process of claim 13, wherein the second phosphorus-containing ligand is a monodentate phosphorus-containing ligand, and
wherein the first phosphorus-containing ligand and the second phosphorus-containing ligand are the same.

Procédé de fabrication d'adiponitrile, ledit procédé comprenant les étapes suivantes : (a) la réaction, dans une première zone de réaction, d'un mélange contenant du 1,3-butadiène (BD) et du cyanure d'hydrogène (HCN) en présence d'un premier catalyseur contenant du nickel de valence nulle et un premier ligand contenant du phosphore, afin d'obtenir un produit de réaction contenant du 3-pentènenitrile (3PN) et du 2-méthyl-3-butènenitrile (2M3BN) ; (b) l'isomérisation d'au moins une partie du 2M3BN de l'étape (a) dans une deuxième zone de réaction en présence d'un deuxième catalyseur contenant du nickel de valence nulle et un deuxième ligand contenant du phosphore, afin d'obtenir un produit de réaction contenant du 3PN ; et (c) la réaction, dans une troisième zone de réaction, d'un mélange contenant le 3PN de l'étape (b) et de cyanure d'hydrogène (HCN) en présence d'un troisième catalyseur contenant du nickel de valence nulle et un troisième ligand contenant du phosphore et en présence d'un promoteur de type acide de Lewis, afin d'obtenir un produit de réaction contenant de l'adiponitrile, dans lequel le catalyseur s'écoule à travers les première, deuxième et troisième zones de réaction, conjointement avec les réactifs et avec les produits,
dans lequel le premier catalyseur est recyclé vers la première zone de réaction à travers une première boucle de recyclage de catalyseur,
dans lequel le troisième catalyseur est recyclé vers la troisième zone de réaction à travers une autre boucle de recyclage de catalyseur,
dans lequel les boucles de recyclage de catalyseur permettant de recycler les premier et troisième catalyseurs sont différentes,
dans lequel une partie du premier catalyseur concentré dans la première boucle de recyclage est purifiée par une étape d'extraction liquide/liquide, et
dans lequel le premier catalyseur purifié est renvoyé dans la première zone de réaction.

Procédé selon la revendication 1, dans lequel les boucles séparées de recyclage de catalyseur permettant de recycler les premier et troisième catalyseurs comprennent au moins un appareil de distillation permettant de concentrer le catalyseur, et où l'appareil de distillation des boucles séparées de recyclage diffère.

Procédé selon la revendication 1, dans lequel une partie du premier catalyseur purifié présent dans la première boucle de recyclage de catalyseur est purgée par prélèvement d'un flux de purge à partir de la première boucle de recyclage de catalyseur,
dans lequel le premier catalyseur présent dans le flux de purge est purifié, et
dans lequel au moins une partie du premier catalyseur purifié est renvoyée vers la première zone de réaction.

Procédé selon la revendication 3, dans lequel le flux de purge provenant de la première boucle de recyclage est conduit dans une première zone d'extraction liquide/liquide conjointement avec un flux de dinitrile et avec un flux d'extraction de solvant,
dans lequel les liquides présents dans la zone d'extraction sont séparés en une phase de solvant d'extraction comprenant le premier catalyseur et en une phase de produit raffiné contenant des dinitriles.

Procédé selon la revendications 4, dans lequel la phase de solvant d'extraction issue de la première zone d'extraction liquide/liquide est distillée pour obtenir le catalyseur purifié qui est renvoyé vers la première zone de réaction.

Procédé selon la revendication 4, dans lequel la phase de produit raffiné contient du solvant d'extraction, des pentènenitriles, des dinitriles et des produits de dégradation de catalyseur,
dans lequel le solvant d'extraction, les pentènenitriles, les dinitriles et les produits de dégradation du catalyseur sont séparés les uns des autres, et où les dinitriles sont recyclés vers la première étape d'extraction liquide/liquide.

Procédé selon la revendication 4, dans lequel au moins une partie de la phase de produit raffiné est transmise vers une section de récupération de produit de type adiponitrile pour récupérer l'adiponitrile produit dans la troisième zone de réaction (Z3).

Procédé selon la revendications 4, dans lequel au moins une partie de la phase de produit raffiné est transmise vers une boucle de produit de recyclage de dinitrile, qui diffère de la section de récupération de produit de type adiponitrile pour récupérer l'adiponitrile produit dans la troisième zone de réaction (Z3).

Procédé selon la revendication 8, dans lequel l'effluent issu de la troisième zone de réaction (Z3) est introduit dans une zone séparée d'extraction liquide/liquide qui diffère de la première zone d'extraction liquide/liquide,
dans lequel un solvant d'extraction est aussi introduit dans la zone séparée d'extraction liquide/liquide, et
dans lequel les liquides présents dans la zone séparée d'extraction liquide/liquide sont séparés en une phase de solvant d'extraction comprenant le troisième catalyseur et une phase de produit raffiné contenant des dinitriles.

Procédé selon la revendication 9, dans lequel la phase de solvant d'extraction issue de la zone séparée d'extraction liquide/liquide est distillée pour obtenir le troisième catalyseur purifié qui est recyclé vers la troisième zone de réaction (Z3).

Procédé selon la revendication 10, dans lequel on fait passer la phase de produit raffiné provenant de la zone séparée d'extraction liquide/liquide de la zone séparée d'extraction liquide/liquide à une section de récupération de produit de type adiponitrile, dans lequel le solvant d'extraction, les pentènenitriles, les dinitriles et les produits de dégradation de catalyseur sont séparés les uns des autres,
dans lequel l'adiponitrile est en outre séparé des autres dinitriles, et
dans lequel on récupère de l'adiponitrile.

Procédé selon la revendication 11, dans lequel une partie de l'adiponitrile récupéré dans la section de récupération de produit de type adiponitrile est recyclé vers la première zone d'extraction liquide/liquide.

Procédé selon la revendication 1, dans lequel le premier ligand contenant du phosphore est un ligand monodentate contenant du phosphore,
dans lequel le deuxième ligand contenant du phosphore est un ligand monodentate contenant du phosphore ou un ligand bidentate contenant du phosphore, et
dans lequel le troisième ligand contenant du phosphore est un ligand bidentate contenant du phosphore.

Procédé selon la revendication 13, dans lequel le deuxième ligand contenant du phosphore est un ligand monodentate contenant du phosphore, et
dans lequel le premier ligand contenant du phosphore et le deuxième ligand contenant du phosphore sont le même.
